title: 2009–10 South West Peninsula League
text:
The 2009–10 South West Peninsula League season was the third in the history of the <a href="South%20West%20Peninsula%20League">South West Peninsula League</a>, a <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in England, that feeds the Premier Division of the <a href="Western%20Football%20League">Western Football League</a>. The league had been formed in 2007 from the merger of the <a href="Devon%20County%20Football%20League">Devon County League</a> and the <a href="South%20Western%20Football%20League">South Western League</a>, and is restricted to clubs based in Cornwall and Devon. The Premier Division of the South West Peninsula League is on the same level of the <a href="National%20League%20System">National League System</a> as the Western League Division One.
The champions for the first time in their history were <a href="Buckland%20Athletic%20F.C.">Buckland Athletic</a>.
Premier Division.
The Premier Division featured 20 teams, the same as the previous season. Two new clubs joined the league after <a href="Newton%20Abbot%20A.F.C.">Newton Abbot</a> were expelled and <a href="Newton%20Abbot%20Spurs%20A.F.C.">Newton Abbot Spurs</a> were relegated to Division One East:
